abstrac: Expert User Interface Designer and web designer
bio:
I'm a B.S in Computer Science, but always loved Design, especially web design. I've been specializing myself in User Centered Design, which gives the website a more pleasant navigation. I've done some coursers in the field, such as Stanford's "Human-Computer Interaction", and Design Thinking workshops.
My knowledge in I.T. contributes to a better understanding of the web and the information architecture. Thus, your clients can easier reach what they aim, through a better projected website. The result for that is a more satisfied client and a more possible returning client, i.e., more ROI.
I value a lot the pixel perfect, the perfect execution with users being happy to use the interface, so I can guarantee the best cost-benefit you can get.
All my websites are done with the best technologies and techniques, follow web standards. Also, they are optimized to all devices (desktop, tablets and mobiles).
Quick, great value, and great satisfaction.

abstrac: Over a decade of experience, and ready to work for you.
bio:
I started as a programmer back in the late 1990's and that lead me to optimizing web sites. From that experience, I've been optimizing content ever since through various media types found on the web. 

But, at the end of the day it's all about conversions. If your content can't be found, no matter how good it is, you won't succeed online.
I work through various hours since we are in a global economy. I can use Skype, phone and email, and prefer Paypal.

abstrac: An arts writer with a Southern heart of gold.....
bio:
I'm a native Mississippian, and graduated from the University of Southern Mississippi in 1997 with degrees in Acting and Music.  Two years later, I relocated to the Syracuse, NY area to work for an educational theater company.  But in 2002, I was the victim of a brutal mugging and assault, and I received a traumatic brain injury in the attack.  Since I no longer had the physical capabilities to perform, I re-established a career as a journalist and author, and I worked as a features writer for two local newspapers before relocating to Key West, Fla., in 2012.

I'm currently in the final stages of publishing a collection of short stories--sort of a humorous memoir.  I enjoy spending my free time laughing at myself and other people.
My hours are very flexible, and I'm willing to spend up to 20 hours per week working on a given project.  Compensation is flexible, too, and will depend on the nature and difficulty of an assignment.

abstrac: Excellent and logical programmer with good exposure to DB work
bio:
I have a Masters Degree in Computer Science and have registered for a PhD. I have been working as an Educator for more than nine years. In addition I have worked with my students on their projects which are typically executed for different software companies. I have good logical analysis skills and am provide a quick turnaround on the tasks I take up.
My strength is my logical programming skills and good database experience.I possess a Masters Degree in Computer Science and have registered for a PhD. I also have excellent communication skills both written and spoken in English.

Payment Method: : I would like to transact through SafePay Escrow especially during the first interaction.In SafePay, I only accept payment by Check, E-check, or Wire Transfer Funds. 
Communication: I prefer e-mail communication but am reachable by phone or chat during specific times agreed upon earlier. Frequency depends on the type of work and details to be discussed.
General Availability: I am a freelancer and work from home. I live in India and prefer to interact between 5:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m. IST on weekdays. I can be contacted anytime on Sunday and Saturday
Feedback / Endorsement: I would be happy to receive your feedback as I would help me to learn from it and improve myself if necessary.
Code of Ethics / Guarantee Policy:I am prepared to refund advance payment done if the work is not to your satisfaction.

For Fixed Price Projects:We offer flexible payment options, primarily structured around a staged "Pay as we Deliver" concept for large projects or you can go ahead with the option of paying 20% agreed price only after completion of 20% of the work. description.title: Honest, Hardworking
description: Skilled in bookkeeping, simple accounting, filing, cold calling, telemarketing, management. Goal oriented, self motivated.

abstrac: Hungry for work, Passionate about it.
bio: I have a wide variety of skill sets obtained over the years through my experience. I graduated high school in 2003 and studied accounting and business management for two years at a local college, at this time I worked as an office assistant for a building contractor and was being prepped for management at my second job . Following I studied criminology and worked as a loss prevention officer. I then worked at a factory building aircraft where I learned to read blueprints, meet tight deadlines and work within stingy government regulations. The Army came next were I became a Combat Medic and served for four years, this gave me wealth of knowledge and perspective on life. I then returned to college finished a degree in nursing. Now I work as a Registered Nurse, as the Charge Nurse, in an Emergency Room for a critical access hospital.
